'''''Amon Hen'' 2''' is the second issue of the [[The Tolkien Society]]'s bimonthly journal ''[[Amon Hen (journal)|Amon Hen]]'', published in December [[1972]]. It was the first issue to be published under the name ''Amon Hen'', following ''[[Henneth Annûn 1]]''.

==Contents==
: ''Note: All content is presumably written by John Martin unless indicated otherwise''
* Editorial note
* "''[[Mallorn (journal)|Mallorns]]'' to Come"
* Committee meeting business
** ''Mallorn'' news
** Annual General Meeting announcement by Belladonna Took ([[Vera Chapman]])
** "Innmoot, London" (report by Vera Chapman)
** Announcement of Archie Mercer as membership secretary
* Letters to the editor by John B. Abbott, Jon Harvey, Graham England, Grahame Lamb, Tony Fallone, Bernard Peek, Gordon Larkin, and Roger Johnson
* "BOOKS…BOOKS…BOOKS…BOOKS…BOOKS…and more BOOKS still!"
** "Books to borrow" by Peter Herring (suggested sci-fi, fantasy, and non-fiction books)
** ''Rocannon's World'' by [[Ursula K. Le Guin]] (reviewed by Graham England)
** ''Njal's Saga'', Penguin Classics edition (reviewed by Graham England)
** ''Grendel'' by John Gardiner (reviewed by Graham England)
* Note on Smials (local branches of the Tolkien Society)
* Letter from [[Marion Zimmer Bradley]]
* List of new members and changes of address
* Note on the sale of [[Tolkien's desk]] by Vera Chapman
* Untitled poem by Robert Grant ("Now Bilbo of Bag End loved rest")
* "Fourteen Twenty" by [[Hartley Patterson]] (column on Tolkien Society committee business)
